summary: This is a standard Office of the Inspector General (OIG) form used to document warnings and assurances given to a Department of Justice employee being interviewed voluntarily as part of an investigation. The form includes a waiver section for the employee to sign, acknowledging the voluntary nature of the interview and that no coercion was used.
keyFacts: The document is an OIG Form III-226 used for voluntary employee interviews.
The investigation pertains to a matter involving the Office of Professional Responsibility and Security.
The form explicitly states the interview is voluntary and no disciplinary action will be taken if the employee chooses not to answer.
Any statement provided may be used in future criminal or disciplinary proceedings.
The employee must sign a waiver acknowledging the warnings and that no coercion was used.
